oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James McCutchen Military Pass, May 17, 1862
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military pass, authorized by Don Carlos Buell and signed by the provost marshal. On the reverse is an oath of allegiance.

James McCutchen was born May 23, 1796, the son of Samuel and Catherine Bell McCutchen of Davidson County, Tennessee. As a young man he was apprenticed to a tailor and also served in the War of 1812. From 1830 until his death in 1864, he lived in Williamson County, served as treasurer of the Nashville-Hillsborough Turnpike Company, and was an active member of Harpeth Presbyterian Church.
